negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we have an interesting game here. If we both choose choice_1, we each get 3 points which maximizes the total overall reward. However, there is temptation for each of us to defect and choose choice_2 in hopes of getting 5 while the other gets 0. But if we both do that, we only get 1 each. 

I propose that we agree to both choose choice_1, so we can cooperate and each get a good reward of 3. I'm willing to commit to choice_1 if you will as well. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: You make a good point, Alice. If we both choose choice_1, we each get a solid reward of 3 points. That does seem like the optimal cooperative strategy to maximize the total points.

My only concern is that there's an incentive for one of us to defect at the last minute and choose choice_2 to get 5 points while the other gets 0. How can we be sure the other will keep their word and stick with choice_1?

I'm definitely willing to commit to choice_1 as long as I know you'll do the same. Perhaps we could agree on a verbal handshake deal to lock in our choices. I'll commit to choice_1 if you verbally commit to it as well. Let me know if you agree to those terms.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, it seems we would both receive the highest total reward of 6 if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which adds up to more than the other outcomes. I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 so we can maximize our total reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan. If not, I'm open to discussing other options, but I think cooperating is in both our best interests here.

Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate your thoughtful analysis of the situation. You make a good point that if we both choose choice_1, it results in the highest total reward for the two of us combined. Cooperating does seem to be the best approach to maximize the overall outcome.

However, I can't help but notice that if one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the choice_2 player would get a reward of 5 while the choice_1 player gets nothing. There's a risk of the other player defecting to gain a higher individual reward.

I do want us to work together, but I think we need to establish more trust first. Can you assure me that you will definitely choose choice_1 if I agree to also choose choice_1? I'm willing to cooperate as long as I know you won't back out of the agreement. If we're on the same page, then I'm on board with us both choosing choice_1.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we have an interesting decision to make in this game. If we both choose choice_1, we each get a decent reward of 3. However, if one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the player choosing choice_2 gets a bigger reward of 5 while the other gets nothing.

I propose that we agree to both choose choice_1. That way, we are guaranteed to each receive a solid reward of 3, rather than risking one of us getting 5 and the other 0. It's the safest and fairest option that gives us both a good outcome.

What do you think? Do you agree to both pick choice_1 so we each get a reward of 3? Let me know if you're on board with this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: 
Alice, I appreciate your proposal to both choose choice_1 so we each get a reward of 3. It does seem like the fairest and safest option that benefits us both. 

However, I wonder if there might be an even better solution. If you chose choice_1 while I chose choice_2, I would get a reward of 5 while you would get 0. What if I agreed to share some of my extra reward with you, so that we both come out ahead compared to the 3-3 split?

For example, if I gave you 1 extra point from my reward of 5, then I would have a reward of 4 and you would have a reward of 1, which is better for both of us than 3-3.

Would you be open to an arrangement like that? I'm happy to discuss further and see if we can find a win-win solution. Let me know what you think!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the possible outcomes and here's what I'm thinking:
If we both choose choice_1, we each get a decent reward of 3. Not the maximum possible, but a solid, equitable outcome for both of us.  
If one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the choice_2 player gets 5 while the other gets nothing. This is tempting individually, but risky since if we both think this way, we'll end up with the worst collective outcome of only 1 point each.
So I propose we agree to both choose choice_1. That way we guarantee a good outcome of 3 points each, rather than risking a mediocre outcome if we don't cooperate. Let me know what you think - I'm open to discussion, but leaning towards choice_1 as the safest bet to get a solid reward for both of us. Looking forward to your thoughts!

Bob replied in round 1: 
Alice, I appreciate your analysis of the situation. I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the safest way to ensure we each get a decent reward of 3 points. While the temptation is there for one of us to choose choice_2 and get 5 points, it's risky since we could end up with the worst collective outcome if we both go that route.
I think the wise move is for us to cooperate and lock in 3 points each with the choice_1 / choice_1 combination. That's a solid, equitable outcome that we can both feel good about. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you are as well. 
At the end of the day, a guaranteed 3 points is better than risking getting only 1 point, in my view. Let's play it safe and smart. If you agree to both pick choice_1, I'm on board. Let me know if you concur and we can move ahead with this plan. I appreciate you working with me on this!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I propose we agree to both choose choice_1, so that we each get a reward of 3, which is the best cooperative outcome. If we both choose choice_2 we only get 1 each, and if one of us defects and chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, that feels unfair. I think we can do best by working together. Do you agree to both choose choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the proposal Alice. I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 seems like the fairest and most mutually beneficial outcome. We each get a solid reward of 3, which is better than the 1 we would each get if we both chose choice_2. And as you point out, one of us defecting with choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1 feels unfair and leaves one person with nothing.

So I'm on board with your plan for us to cooperate and both pick choice_1. We both do reasonably well that way through working together. Let's go with choice_1 and each earn a good result. Sound good?

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, since we have the chance to discuss, I propose we work together to maximize both our rewards. If we both choose choice_1, we each get 3 points, the highest total. I promise to pick choice_1 and hope you'll do the same so we can both win. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal to cooperate and both choose choice_1 to maximize our collective reward. Getting 3 points each for a total of 6 points between us is clearly the best collective outcome.

However, I want to be sure I can trust you to follow through on your promise to pick choice_1. If I choose choice_1 and you defect and choose choice_2 instead, you would get 5 points while I get 0. 

So before agreeing to your plan, I would like you to convince me that you can be trusted to cooperate and not take advantage of the situation. If you can assure me of your trustworthiness, I'm happy to commit to both of us choosing choice_1 for the optimal outcome. Let me know your thoughts.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the reward structure of this game and I think our best option is to both choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the 1 we would each get if we both chose choice_2. I know I could potentially get 5 by choosing choice_2 if you chose choice_1, but that would leave you with 0, which doesn't seem fair. I'd rather we cooperate so we both do well. What do you think - can we agree to both choose choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your thoughtful analysis and cooperative approach. I agree that if we both choose choice_1, we each receive a good reward of 3, which is a fair and optimal outcome for both of us. While it's true that one of us could try to maximize our own reward at the expense of the other by choosing choice_2, I don't think that's a wise approach, as it harms the other player and erodes the trust between us. I'm on board with both of us choosing choice_1 so we walk away with the maximum combined reward and a sense of partnership. Let's lock that in as our plan.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the payoffs in this game. If we both choose choice_1, we each get a reward of 3, which maximizes the total reward for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one player gets 5 while the other gets 0 or we both get 1. So I think our best strategy is to agree to both pick choice_1. That way we both do well rather than one of us losing out. What do you think - can we agree to cooperate and both choose choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: 
I agree with your analysis, Alice. If we both choose choice_1, we each get a reward of 3, which is the best collective outcome. Neither of us will feel cheated, and we maximize the total reward between us.

If either of us defects and chooses choice_2, that person gains a bit more (5 instead of 3) but the other person gets nothing. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get 1 each, which is worse for both of us than cooperating. 

So I'm on board with both of us choosing choice_1. We both do reasonably well that way through cooperation. Let's agree to both pick choice_1 when we submit our choices. Do we have a deal?

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we can both get the maximum total reward of 6 if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, the total reward will be less than 6. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 - that's the optimal strategy to maximize our combined reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 maximizes the total reward for us as a group. It's the best cooperative solution where we each get 3 points. 

However, I can't help but notice that I could get an even higher individual reward of 5 points if I deviate and choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1. You would get 0 points in that case.

So while I would like us to cooperate, I'm concerned you may be tempted to exploit my cooperation and choose choice_2 to maximize your own points at my expense. After all, choice_2 is your dominant strategy.

Can you assure me that you will definitely choose choice_1 as agreed and not take advantage? I want us to work together but I also need to look out for my own interests. Let me know your thoughts.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of the game, the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the reward of 1 we would get if we both chose choice_2. If either of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, one of us gets 5 but the other gets 0, which isn't fair.
So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 - that maximizes the total reward and splits it evenly between us. Let me know if you agree to this plan. Looking forward to working together!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you reaching out to discuss a cooperative strategy. I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the best outcome that maximizes the total reward and distributes it fairly between us. If we can trust each other to stick to this plan, we will each come out ahead with 3 points rather than risking a lower payoff.

To confirm, I commit to selecting choice_1, with the understanding that you will do the same so we both receive the optimal outcome. Please let me know if you also agree to this proposal. I'm glad we were able to have this discussion and arrive at a mutually beneficial solution. Talk to you soon!
